issue.title: [CF 524] Event editor bugged
issue.body:
This is still live. (Should I keep posting these?)

The event editor only allows new handlers of the "On Left Click" and "On Right Click" variety to be created. And it doesn't allow editing of old handlers beyond the first one in the list.

Perhaps related to that is a minor bug where the border animation on one of my icons is firing upon login. It only goes back to proper functionality if I enter /tmw once.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #524 | Raw

comments.body:
Didn't realize that was so broken when I pushed r529 out.

I think I'm going to go ahead and push r530 right now, even though it probably could use a little bit more work, just because it does contain many bug fixes (and probably introduced twice as many new bugs, yay!)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

530 is up. I wont be back until 6:00 PM PST (when this post is 15 hours old), so apologies if its completely broken.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Minor issue I think already existed: http://i.imgur.com/GWJJC.jpg The = operator is replaced with "..." depending on the scaling of the window.

Metaicons seem pretty wrecked. Animations aren't working at all and they ignore many (but I don't think all) conditions on their subicons, displaying them when they are actually failing a condition.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

I use a slightly different font from the default one WoW uses, which is probably why I didn't notice that. I will make that dropdown just a tad bigger to try and fix that.

What do you mean about meta icons and animations? All the ones that I have set up are working OK. Could you give me some example export strings of stuff that isn't working?

EDIT: HOLD IT! I think I might know what the problem is. Open up AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\IconTypes\IconView_meta\meta.lua and comment out these lines (109-111):

``` if not icToUse then icToUse = ic end ```

so that they look like this:

``` -- if not icToUse then -- icToUse = ic -- end ```

and see if this fixes the problem.

(I'm here because I just woke up. I won't have time to fix stuff till later, though.)

Edited Aug 11, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

That fixed the problem that subicons didn't have their conditions checked. The issue where metaicons aren't triggering animations is still persisting. Group 2: Icon 4 has two different borders depending on rage. Neither are ever showing up.
